definition: incantation/magic spell/curse/malediction/to revile/to put a curse on sb

sentences.english: Freshness and quality are the mantras of these menus.
sentences.chinese: 鲜度和质量是这些菜单的咒语。

sentences.english: You want to know why the spell didn't break, hmm, Vergil?
sentences.chinese: 你想知道为什么咒语没有解开吗，嗯，维吉尔？

sentences.english: That weaves its spell on even a stone heart?
sentences.chinese: 竟把咒语织进铁石心肠？

sentences.english: It’s a great mantra to use when life becomes a little challenging.
sentences.chinese: 当生活出现小问题时，这是个挺棒的咒语。

sentences.english: This is an incantation that can  spell anybody.
sentences.chinese: 这是一句能迷惑住人的咒语。

sentences.english: It is sorcerers and charlatans who accept money for their spells and prayers.
sentences.chinese: 江湖术士才会接受金钱去贩卖他们的咒语和祈祷。

sentences.english: Perhaps an emissary will find this incantation and undo that which has been done.
sentences.chinese: 或许使者将发现这个咒语并且取消做了的那。

sentences.english: But not yet, my mantra says.
sentences.chinese: 但是我的咒语说，不行，时机未到。

sentences.english: He uttered imprecations under his breath.
Made him shit flowers every time he had a cruel thought.
sentences.chinese: 这个咒语让他每次有了一个残酷的想法就会拉稀。

sentences.english: Description: One of the Unforgivable Curses. The imperius curse gives the spell-caster complete control over their victim.
sentences.chinese: 不可饶恕咒之一，这个咒语能完全控制受害者。

sentences.english: Dumbledore sent a message to Hagrid using this spell.
sentences.chinese: 邓布利多在给海格送口信的时候用到了这个咒语。

sentences.english: The cooldown time for Binding Word has been changed from 5minutes to 45 seconds.
sentences.chinese: 束厄局促之咒语的冷却时间由5分改为45秒。

sentences.english: In the world the simple the incantation, three characters "I accompany you".
sentences.chinese: 世界上最简单的咒语，三个字“我陪你”。

sentences.english: Saying "I love you"is the open sesame to experience the Divine.
sentences.chinese: 说“我爱你”是打开神性之门的咒语。

sentences.english: And the one who will lift the incantation is you, his own son.
sentences.chinese: 而那个能够解除咒语的人就是你，他的儿子。

definition: to chant a magic spell/to recite incantations
to read out/to recite/to remember sb (while talking about sth else)
incantation/magic spell/curse/malediction/to revile/to put a curse on sb
true statement/incantation (translates Sanskrit: dharani 陀羅尼|陀罗尼)
to implement the law/to perform sorcery
variant of 念念有詞|念念有词[nian4 nian4 you3 ci2]
to read aloud/to recite rhythmically/to chant/to intone (esp. poems in rhythm)
